content.description: The following question refers to the topic of the rise of global markets in the 1700s.
content.question: Which of the following best explains why the major European sea powers vied for control over the Atlantic in the 1700s?

choices.label: European states increasingly relied on imports of staple foods from the Americas.
European states relied on Atlantic fisheries as sources of state revenue.
European states increasingly imported luxury goods such as sugar and coffee from the Americas.
European states increasingly attempted to enforce free-trade policies.

content.answer: European states increasingly imported luxury goods such as sugar and coffee from the Americas.

unit.text: 5: Conflict, Crisis, and Reaction in the Late 18th Century

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
